title: David Schwimmer in Chilling Tale 'Goosebumps: The Vanishing' Trailer
description: "Dad's behind all the crazy stuff happening." Disney+ has revealed a new trailer for the next season of their Goosebumps horror anthology series - called Goosebumps: The Vanishing, with David Schwimmer as the poster boy (literally) for this next chilling tale. The Vanishing is an 8 episode mini-series continuation of the Goosebumps series from last year - created by filmmakers Rob Letterman and Nicholas Stoller; based on R. L. Stine's books of the same name. Schwimmer stars as Anthony Brewer, a former botany professor who gets infected. "After his brother went missing with a group of kids in 1994, who local teens believe 'were killed by ghosts,' Anthony looks into evidence from the scene, which infects him with a mysterious symbiotic organism." It also follows the twins Cece & Devin and their friends who also find themselves entangled in the chilling tale of four teens who vanished in 1994. The cast includes Ana Ortiz, Jayden Bartels, Sam McCarthy, Elijah M. Cooper, Francesca Noel, and Galilea La Salvia. At first glance this reminds me of the Jordy Verrill part of Creepshow with the alien plant. This does look creepy but also quite cheesy, too. Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for […]
author: Alex Billington

Disney+ has revealed a new trailer for the next season of their Goosebumps horror anthology series - called Goosebumps: The Vanishing, with David Schwimmer as the poster boy (literally) for this next chilling tale. text: by October 20, 2024Source: YouTube "Dad's behind all the crazy stuff happening." Disney+ has revealed a new trailer for the next season of their Goosebumps horror anthology series - called Goosebumps: The Vanishing, with David Schwimmer as the poster boy (literally) for this next chilling tale. The Vanishing is an 8 episode mini-series continuation of the Goosebumps series from last year - created by filmmakers Rob Letterman and Nicholas Stoller; based on R. L. Stine's books of the same name. Schwimmer stars as Anthony Brewer, a former botany professor who gets infected. "After his brother went missing with a group of kids in 1994, who local teens believe 'were killed by ghosts,' Anthony looks into evidence from the scene, which infects him with a mysterious symbiotic organism." It also follows the twins Cece & Devin and their friends who also find themselves entangled in the chilling tale of four teens who vanished in 1994. The cast includes Ana Ortiz, Jayden Bartels, Sam McCarthy, Elijah M. Cooper, Francesca Noel, and Galilea La Salvia. At first glance this reminds me of the Jordy Verrill part of Creepshow with the alien plant. This does look creepy but also quite cheesy, too. Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Disney+'s Goosebumps: The Vanishing, direct from YouTube: Goosebumps: The Vanishing begins with fraternal twins Cece (Jayden Bartels) & Devin (Sam McCarthy) adjusting to life with their recently divorced dad, Anthony. When the duo discovers a threat stirring, they quickly realize that dark secrets are among them, triggering a chain of events that unravel a profound mystery. As they delve deeper into the unknown, Devin, Cece & their friends — Alex, CJ, Frankie — find themselves entangled in the chilling tale of 4 teenagers who mysteriously vanished in 1994. Goosebumps: The Vanishing is the new season of this anthology horror series on Disney+. Goosebumps is a series created by filmmakers Rob Letterman (Shark Tale, Monsters vs. Aliens, Gulliver's Travels, Pokémon: Detective Pikachu Goosebumps movie) and Nicholas Stoller (Forgetting Sarah Marshall, Get Him to the Greek, Neighbor 1 & 2, Storks, Bros). Showrun by Hilary Winston and Letterman. Executive produced by Stoller, Letterman, Neal H. Moritz, Pavun Shetty, Iole Lucchesse, Conor Wrench, Caitlin Friedman. Disney debuts Goosebumps: The Vanishing streaming on Disney+ starting January 10th, 2025 coming soon. Any good? Find more posts: Horror, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer
html:
by
October 20, 2024
Source: YouTube

"Dad's behind all the crazy stuff happening." Disney+ has revealed a new trailer for the next season of their Goosebumps horror anthology series - called Goosebumps: The Vanishing, with David Schwimmer as the poster boy (literally) for this next chilling tale. The Vanishing is an 8 episode mini-series continuation of the Goosebumps series from last year - created by filmmakers Rob Letterman and Nicholas Stoller; based on R. L. Stine's books of the same name. Schwimmer stars as Anthony Brewer, a former botany professor who gets infected. "After his brother went missing with a group of kids in 1994, who local teens believe 'were killed by ghosts,' Anthony looks into evidence from the scene, which infects him with a mysterious symbiotic organism." It also follows the twins Cece & Devin and their friends who also find themselves entangled in the chilling tale of four teens who vanished in 1994. The cast includes Ana Ortiz, Jayden Bartels, Sam McCarthy, Elijah M. Cooper, Francesca Noel, and Galilea La Salvia. At first glance this reminds me of the Jordy Verrill part of Creepshow with the alien plant. This does look creepy but also quite cheesy, too.

Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Disney+'s Goosebumps: The Vanishing, direct from YouTube:

Goosebumps: The Vanishing begins with fraternal twins Cece (Jayden Bartels) & Devin (Sam McCarthy) adjusting to life with their recently divorced dad, Anthony. When the duo discovers a threat stirring, they quickly realize that dark secrets are among them, triggering a chain of events that unravel a profound mystery. As they delve deeper into the unknown, Devin, Cece & their friends — Alex, CJ, Frankie — find themselves entangled in the chilling tale of 4 teenagers who mysteriously vanished in 1994. Goosebumps: The Vanishing is the new season of this anthology horror series on Disney+. Goosebumps is a series created by filmmakers Rob Letterman (Shark Tale, Monsters vs. Aliens, Gulliver's Travels, Pokémon: Detective Pikachu Goosebumps movie) and Nicholas Stoller (Forgetting Sarah Marshall, Get Him to the Greek, Neighbor 1 & 2, Storks, Bros). Showrun by Hilary Winston and Letterman. Executive produced by Stoller, Letterman, Neal H. Moritz, Pavun Shetty, Iole Lucchesse, Conor Wrench, Caitlin Friedman. Disney debuts Goosebumps: The Vanishing streaming on Disney+ starting January 10th, 2025 coming soon. Any good?

Find more posts: Horror, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer
